name: The Oberoi, Mauritius

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We holidayed here in March - second time in two years. I recommend it very highly.
reviews.title: Hugely Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: I am not one to praise lightly - however it is difficult not to be hugely impressed by this hotel. Our experience, over two holidays, has been outstanding.
reviews.title: Have never felt so welcome and spoiled ..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel that ticks all the boxes - outstanding service, great food, staff who just can't do enough for you, 1st class spa, beautiful spacious rooms all set in magnificent zen like gardens - a sanctuary of peace and tranquility.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD, RESTAURANTS & BAR: We loved the food, there are two restaurants with quite different menus offering plenty of choice for a longer stay. One is slightly formal, the other more relaxed serving a fabulous choice of super fresh seafood - all grilled within view and right on the edge of the water.
reviews.title: Special dinner at the Oberoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is one bar set high to optimize the ocean view - it just felt heavenly sitting there with a cocktail over looking the shimmering sunset. Get there early to get the best seats.
reviews.title: Extrahordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed being the hotel. We did not need to go out. There are enough activities. For example, most of marine activities are free and some class everyday, like Yoga.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: I love the flowers within the hotel area which is well-maintained. The staffs were nice.
reviews.title: Fabulous week. Notable points that made a...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was ok, nothing was wow, but fine. As this is an expensive famous resort, I expect more.
reviews.title: Truely amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were nice and sea was clean and easy to swim.
reviews.title: Amazing property with amazing service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to go back there again.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent a glorious eight nights at The Oberoi and can't compliment the staff, facilities and food enough.
reviews.title: Everything we hoped for and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was our honeymoon we were willing to push the boat out on the price and go for luxury. We certainly got what we'd hoped for on that score, absolute honeymoon paradise. All our needs were catered to, the food was incredible and the staff were genuinely helpful. Service always came with a smile and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Absolute perfect honeymoon destination. Best holiday ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We wanted somewhere we could relax after a hectic period in the run up to the wedding and the Oberoi was perfect. However, we also wanted somewhere that had activities to keep us entertained once we'd got our energy back and with the water skiing, biking, kayaking and snorkelling there was plenty to do.
reviews.title: Just a perfect paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we were to return to Mauritius we would stay at the Oberoi without a doubt.
reviews.title: Honeymoon from heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the luxury villa's with a swimming pool, and it was truly amazing. We were on our honeymoon and it was the perfect hideaway, with pool and villa all to ourselves. The food and service were top class, staff so friendly and helpful. Would recommend staying half board though as the hotel food prices are high. The villas have amazing bathrooms, beds and gardens. The Spa is great, and the attention to detail is second to none. It is expensive, but if you're treating yourself to a special holiday then this place is the one. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for Weddingmoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is overrated for what it is, I believe much has to do with the proximity to the airport and the capital. It is a good hotel for the area and for a business travel but not for the leisure island traveller seeking a relaxing, pampering 5 star experience. Mauritius has some fantastic hotel options, this just isn't one of them.
reviews.title: Mediocre for this bracket of hotel esp for Mauritius

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service food and service was dire; for example the kitchen where the meals are cooked are a distance from the rooms, creating a situation where no matter what you order it will be lukewarm or cold. The bread will be soggy in the sandwiches and the drinks will be watery. This of course is not the fault of the staff but what is their fault is getting orders wrong, not once but virtually every time.
reviews.title: Greatest Hotel experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for 10 nights on the breakfast + dinner option so really did experience the food and it is not great, your local takeway could have fresher, better executed and more exciting food options - seriously.
reviews.title: Amazing perfection with subtle luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room; where do I start ? The mattress was the hardest one I have ever slept on ever. It was like sleeping on a slab, the air conditioning was very weak, the shower and bathtub needed recaulking and in some areas there was mold..tiles were missing and it looked unfinished under the sink and around the toilet. Surprising for what they are selling these rooms for.
reviews.title: takes my breath away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool/ beach areas: the pools were cold, granted we were not there in the warmest time of the year so the water may have been colder than summer but it was unacceptable, the beach is tiny and the service is poor and slow, no water is offered when you sit unless you wait for half an hour, so forget about star touches like towels laid out for you or sunglasses cleaned for you when you go for a swim, non existent here. There are two pools both are smallish, one is quite small for a hotel this size. The larger pool has some very bizarre features such as jets around it that can't really be used as they are covered in a hard gritty tile that scratches your skin, there is a bell that hangs over the pool that has spiked metal leaves dangling from it that are sharp - be careful esp with kids. All in all, both pools were uninviting, the service at the pools was dire. Staff looked bored and never smiled, it took ages for someone to come to service you with drinks or food - the food at the pools is worse than room service, even though the kitchen is on site at the larger pool, we are talking reheated, frozen type fare. Very poor and very expensive for what it is, for ex; my husband and I had two personal pizzas and two sprites - over £40 pounds, absurd, it was the worst pizza we had ever had.
reviews.title: An amazing honeymoon at an amazing resort
Construction work ongoing
reviews.text: It's not right that the construction work has stopped.

reviews.title: Contruction at nearby resort affecting the Oberoi....
reviews.text: We checked out today - 22 Aug. The diggers had started by about 7.30am (it's a Sunday too!). Many of the 'pavillion' rooms are affected. Apart from this, lovely resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyone booked to stay at the Oberoi, Mauritius should be aware that the nearby Grand Mauritian resort is having construction work which could affect your stay at the Oberoi. Other travellers have said noise and visible diggers etc are some of the things which impacted their stay.
reviews.title: Almost too luxurious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Athough technically the Oberoi is running as usual, travellers I believe should be made aware in advance. You should check with your agent / the hotel about this directly to see what your options are.
reviews.title: Honeymoon paradise found
Tranquil beach resort, 5* service, Amazing.
reviews.text: It's supposed to be a great hotel - why we booked but would not be happy staying there if there was disturbance from nearby hotel construction work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a garden lanai for 12 nights at the end of April. We stayed at the Oberoi becuase we enjoyed superb settings and service at the Oberoi Mauritius and 2 Oberois in India.
reviews.title: A perfect Honeymoon in Mauritius

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general the stay was superb- both the hotel, the setting and the island, with some of the most amazing memories to fall back on.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will deal with the very few areas that i would have preferred were different:
reviews.title: Oberoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Settings- wish they hadn't built the new hotel across the bay
reviews.title: As good as it gets?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Cost- we did make use of everything on offer (ie Spa, guided trips, alcohol, food in hotel, room service etc etc), but be very aware this is not a holiday to skimp on. We were pleased with the value for money, but the dent in our account was larger than planned.
reviews.title: A true gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a long time deciding where to stay in Mauritius and I can stay that it was worth it. We had a private taxi from the airport to hotel. Despite the weather when we arrived we got a great reception from all the staff. Then they are there for all your needs and ever present when you need something. The service is one reason to choose this hotel! Even when on one of the 3 beaches the staff are there handing out free water and ice cold towels. We stayed in the pavilion, the rooms are of a high standard, I did enjoy the sunken bath in the bathroom! Food is very good, the choice at breakfast is huge. At night I would recommend the on the rocks restaurant for an on the beach BBQ
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at The Oberoi and it was really a struggle to leave. The hotel is beautiful; everything from the standard of the rooms to the gardens, the pools and beaches are just stunning. We stayed in a Luxury Pavilion which was spacious and well equipped with a lovely bathroom complete with open air shower and sunken bath. However, the icing on the cake was the service. All the staff, without exception, are friendly, helpful, smiling and nothing is too much trouble. You really can ask for anything and they will do their utmost to get it for you. The Manager, Marc Denton, is charm personified and more than happy to stop for a chat as he patrols the hotel every day. This hotel is truly idyllic and perfect for a romantic break away. Not great for kids as there is not much for them to do but that was a definite plus in our view as screaming tots would have rather spoiled the atmosphere of calm and peacefulness. One thing I will also highly recommend that any visitors to the hotel do is to take up the offer of the day's horseracing at the Crown Lodge, Mauritius Turf Club. It's a wonderful day out, open bar and delicious snacks, plus the excellent company of the very jovial Jacques Ritter and his team in the Crown Lodge box. Do go, it's well worth it! We will certainly be going back to this hotel and to the races!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, really lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary with a 10 day stay at The Oberoi. We have been back just over a week now but the aura of tranquility and enjoyment still resonates and I just want a Tardis so I can get back there easily.This was truly our best holiday ever and we have travelled extensively.The combination of its peaceful and isolated location, the exceptional service from staff, the stunning michelin quality cuisine and the peacefulness that never leaves you puts this in a league of its own.
reviews.title: Holiday of a lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: More words fail me but you get my drift.Try it if you possibly can and you will not be disapointed in this truly exceptional hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel I stumbled over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst rambling through the country I stopped here for a few weeks.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!
What a lovely break!
reviews.text: We stayed here for one week in April and it was lovely, we couldn't fault the hotel on a single thing. The staff were extremely helpful without being OTT, the facilities were great, the food was lovely with the really nice touch that you had a choice of four places to eat if you were on half board so you didn't get bored. I can really recommend it and we were sad to leave. Honestly can't think of a single fault with this lovely place, well done to all the staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a world class resort run with extreme efficiency and superb caring. Although these sound like opposites, here they are complimentary. Whilst I can’t say nothing went wrong, the few things that did, for example a very weak Wi-Fi in our room, this was attended to and corrected within a matter of minutes. If something wasn’t to our liking, the one evening room service took forever to clear, when we ordered from room service again, there was a little extra dish in the form of an apology. In short, this resort is a rather special place with exemplary service being the centre of their success.
reviews.title: World Beater

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Whilst it has a superb spa facility, we realised rather early on in our stay that the whole resort is really a spa. From remembering your name, learning what you like/dislike to just generally pampering guests, each member of staff is polite, attentive and very helpful.
reviews.title: Superb discreet 5 star luxury service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Unsolicited flowers and a most delicious chocolate mousse cake on my wife’s birthday are testimony of this.
reviews.title: A very special luxurious hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Be aware that some rooms have better sea views than others. Ours, 508 and generally those from 501 to 512
reviews.title: Most excellent resort

aka: The Oberoi Mauritius Hotel Pointe Aux Piments
